snippet: Some veterans of Kiev’s Independence Square are healing abroad, physically and mentally, from the bloody protests that helped topple Ukraine’s president.
abstract: Several dozen Ukrainian veterans of Kiev's Independence Square protests have been sent abroad to European cities to heal from physical and mental wounds sustained during nation's revolution; those who survived the bloody riots could prove to be important witnesses to the events of Feb 18- 21.

byline.contributor: Hana de Goeij contributed reporting from Prague, and Victor Homola from Berlin.

lead_paragraph: Some veterans of Kiev’s Independence Square are healing abroad, physically and mentally, from the bloody protests that helped topple Ukraine’s president.

headline.seo: Veterans of Ukraine’s Revolution Recall Violence in Kiev
headline.main: Tending Their Wounds, Vowing to Fight On
headline.print_headline: Tending Their Wounds, Vowing to Fight On
